name: timework
theory: Time and Work problems involve calculating how long it takes one or more people to complete a task, based on their individual or combined work rates. The key formula is Work = Rate × Time, and typically, the work is considered as 1 unit (i.e., completing the whole job).

questions.question: A can do a job in 10 days. B can do the same job in 15 days. How long will they take together?
questions.solution: A's 1 day work = 1/10, B's 1 day work = 1/15. Combined = 1/10 + 1/15 = (3+2)/30 = 5/30 = 1/6. So they complete the work in 6 days.

questions.question: C can do a job in 8 days. D in 12 days. If they work together, how many days will they take?
questions.solution: C's 1 day = 1/8, D's 1 day = 1/12. Combined = (3+2)/24 = 5/24. So they finish in 24/5 = 4.8 days.

questions.question: A is twice as fast as B. A and B together finish a job in 12 days. How many days will B alone take?
questions.solution: Let B take x days. Then A = x/2 days. Together = 1/x + 2/x = 3/x = 1/12 ⇒ x = 36. So B takes 36 days.

questions.question: E can do a work in 5 days. F can do the same in 10 days. E works for 2 days, F completes the rest. How many total days?
questions.solution: E’s 1 day work = 1/5 ⇒ 2 days = 2/5. Remaining = 1 - 2/5 = 3/5. F = 1/10 per day ⇒ Time = 3/5 ÷ 1/10 = 6 days. Total = 2 + 6 = 8 days.

questions.question: G can finish a work in 20 days. He worked alone for 4 days, then H joined and together they finished in 10 more days. Find H's time alone.
If 12 men can do a work in 15 days, how many men are needed to complete the same in 10 days?
A and B can complete a task in 18 days. B and C in 24 days. A and C in 36 days. In how many days can A, B, and C complete it together?
If A alone does 40% of a work and B completes the rest in 9 days, how long would A and B take together?
questions.solution: 40% work done ⇒ 60% in 9 days ⇒ Full work = 9/0.6 = 15 days. So combined = 15 days.

questions.question: A can do a work in 15 days, B in 25 days. They start together, but after 5 days, A leaves. How long will B take to finish?
A does 1/3 of a job in 5 days. How many days to finish the whole job?
Two workers complete a job in 12 days. One does twice as much as the other. How many days would faster one take alone?
questions.solution: Let A do 2x, B do x ⇒ Total = 3x ⇒ A = 2/3 of work ⇒ 12 × 2/3 = 8 days.

questions.question: A, B and C together can finish a task in 10 days. A alone in 30 days, B in 20. Find C’s time alone.
A and B can finish a task in 6 days. A alone takes 10 days. How long will B take alone?
If 5 men can complete a work in 12 days, how many days will 8 men take?
A, B and C can complete a work in 10, 15, and 20 days respectively. How long will they take together?
A can do a job in 24 days, B in 32 days. They start together, but A leaves after 6 days. B finishes. Total time?
B works twice as fast as A. Together they do a work in 12 days. A alone?
questions.solution: A = x days, B = x/2 ⇒ 1/x + 2/x = 3/x = 1/12 ⇒ x = 36. A alone = 36 days.

questions.question: 20 women complete a task in 15 days. If 5 women leave after 5 days, how long will the rest take?
questions.solution: Total work = 20×15=300. Work done in 5 days = 20×5=100. Remaining = 200. Remaining women = 15 ⇒ Time = 200/15 ≈ 13.33 days.

questions.question: X and Y can finish a work in 30 and 20 days respectively. Y worked for 10 days, then X finished. Total days?
questions.solution: Y’s 10 day work = 10/20 = 0.5. Remaining = 0.5. X = 1/30/day ⇒ Time = 0.5 ÷ 1/30 = 15 days. Total = 10 + 15 = 25 days.

questions.question: A does half the work in 10 days. B finishes rest in 5 days. Together?
questions.solution: A = 0.5 in 10 ⇒ full = 20. B = 0.5 in 5 ⇒ full = 10. Combined rate = 1/20 + 1/10 = 3/20 ⇒ Time = 20/3 ≈ 6.67 days.

name: percentages
theory: Percentages are used to express proportions and compare ratios. A percentage represents a fraction of 100. The formula to convert a percentage to a number is: (percentage / 100) × total. They are commonly used in exams, discounts, population growth, interest rates, and more.

questions.question: What is 20% of 150?
If a shirt costs ₹800 and there is a 25% discount, what is the sale price?
A number is increased by 20% and then decreased by 20%. What is the net change?
questions.solution: Let the number be 100. Increase: 100 → 120. Decrease: 120 → 96. Net change = 96 - 100 = -4 ⇒ 4% decrease

questions.question: A’s income is 40% more than B’s. By what percent is B’s income less than A’s?
What percent of 90 is 18?
If 60% of a number is 48, what is the number?
questions.solution: Let the number be x ⇒ 60% of x = 48 ⇒ (60/100)×x = 48 ⇒ x = 80

questions.question: In a school of 1200 students, 25% are girls. How many boys are there?
If the price of an item is increased from ₹500 to ₹600, what is the percentage increase?
Find the percentage change if a value decreases from 240 to 180.
30% of a number is 72. What is the number?
questions.solution: Let the number be x ⇒ 30% of x = 72 ⇒ x = 72 × 100 / 30 = 240

questions.question: What is 150% of 80?
A population grows by 10% every year. If the current population is 5000, what will it be after 1 year?
What is the percentage profit if an article is bought for ₹400 and sold for ₹480?
If a person spends 60% of his income and saves ₹4000, what is his total income?
What percent is 3 hours of a day?
A student scored 360 marks out of 500. What is his percentage score?
If 75% of students passed an exam and 150 failed, how many students appeared?
A number is increased by 15%. If the new number is 230, what was the original number?
An item was sold for ₹690 after a 23% discount. What was the original price?
Find the percent change when a quantity goes from 80 to 100.

name: ratios and proportions
theory: A ratio is a way to compare two quantities. A proportion states that two ratios are equal. They are useful in problems involving comparisons, scaling, and part-to-whole relationships.

questions.question: If A:B = 2:3 and B:C = 4:5, find A:B:C.
questions.solution: A:B = 2:3, B:C = 4:5 ⇒ Make B same: A:B:C = 8:12:15.

questions.question: The ratio of income to expenditure is 3:2. If income is Rs. 2400, find expenditure.
The ratio of boys to girls is 5:7. If there are 120 girls, how many boys are there?
Divide Rs. 1000 in the ratio 3:2.
Find the fourth proportional to 3, 9, and 12.
A and B share profits in 7:3. If total profit is Rs. 5000, find B’s share.
The ratio of ages of A and B is 4:5. After 5 years, the ratio becomes 5:6. Find their present ages.
What must be added to both terms of the ratio 2:3 so that it becomes 5:6?
Two numbers are in the ratio 5:6. If the sum is 121, find the numbers.
Find the mean proportional between 4 and 16.
If A:B = 3:4 and B:C = 5:6, find A:B:C.
A and B are in the ratio 2:3. If A is increased by 20% and B by 10%, what is the new ratio?
Divide Rs. 1800 among A, B, and C in the ratio 3:4:5.
Find third proportional to 4 and 8.
If 5A = 7B, find A:B.
What number should be added to 3 and 5 so that the ratio becomes 2:3?
The salaries of A and B are in ratio 5:4. Each receives an increment of Rs. 1000. New ratio = 7:6. Find their original salaries.
questions.solution: Let salaries be 5x and 4x ⇒ (5x+1000)/(4x+1000) = 7/6 ⇒ x = 2000 ⇒ Salaries = 10,000 and 8000.

questions.question: A and B can complete work in 10 and 15 days. Ratio of work done by A to B?
If A:B = 4:3, and B:C = 2:5, then A:C = ?
questions.solution: B is common: A:B = 4:3, B:C = 6:15 ⇒ A:C = 8:15.

questions.question: If a:b = 2:3 and b:c = 4:5, then find a:c.
questions.solution: Make b common: a:b = 8:12, b:c = 12:15 ⇒ a:c = 8:15.

name: simpleinterest
theory: Simple Interest (SI) is calculated on the original principal throughout the entire period. The formula is SI = (P × R × T)/100, where P = Principal, R = Rate, T = Time.

questions.question: Find the simple interest on Rs. 1200 for 2 years at 5% per annum.
What is the SI on Rs. 5000 at 6% for 3 years?
How much time will Rs. 1000 take to earn Rs. 200 as SI at 5% p.a?
At what rate will Rs. 800 amount to Rs. 920 in 3 years?
Find principal if SI is Rs. 400, rate 10%, and time 2 years.
In how many years will Rs. 1500 become Rs. 1950 at 10% p.a?
A sum doubles in 10 years. Find rate of interest.
Rs. 4000 becomes Rs. 4600 in 3 years. Find the rate.
If SI for 4 years is Rs. 800 on Rs. 2000, find rate.
What is the SI on Rs. 3000 at 8% for 2.5 years?
In how many years will Rs. 2500 become Rs. 3000 at 10% p.a?
If SI is Rs. 240 for 2 years at 6%, find the principal.
At what rate will Rs. 2000 yield Rs. 400 in 4 years?
If Rs. 1800 becomes Rs. 2160 in 4 years, what is rate?
How much interest does Rs. 2400 earn in 1.5 years at 8%?
A sum of Rs. 10000 earns Rs. 1200 in 3 years. Find rate.
If Rs. 2500 earns Rs. 750 in 5 years, what is rate?
Find time if Rs. 1500 earns Rs. 450 at 6% p.a.
Rs. 1600 earns Rs. 320 at 8% p.a. Find time.
In how many years will Rs. 3000 amount to Rs. 3900 at 10% p.a?

name: speed & distance
theory: Speed and distance problems involve calculating how fast something is moving, how far it travels, or how long it takes. The key formulas are: Speed = Distance / Time, Distance = Speed × Time, Time = Distance / Speed.

questions.question: A car covers 150 km in 3 hours. What is its speed?
If a train runs at 60 km/h and covers 180 km, how much time does it take?
A man walks 20 km at 5 km/h. How long does he take?
How far will a car travel in 2.5 hours at a speed of 80 km/h?
A train 120 m long crosses a pole in 6 seconds. Find its speed in km/h.
A cyclist covers 60 km in 4 hours. What is his average speed?
If a car's speed is 90 km/h, how much time will it take to cover 450 km?
A runner covers 1.5 km in 5 minutes. What is his speed in km/h?
A man walks at 6 km/h. How far will he walk in 50 minutes?
A train covers a distance of 300 km in 4 hours. What is the average speed?
A car goes 120 km in 2 hours and returns in 3 hours. What is the average speed?
If a bus travels at 60 km/h for 1.5 hours, how much distance will it cover?
A man runs 10 km in 50 minutes. What is his speed in m/s?
A train crosses a 150 m platform in 12 seconds. Its speed is 60 km/h. Find the train length.
Speed of a boat in still water is 12 km/h. Speed of stream is 3 km/h. What is the downstream speed?
A train of 180 m takes 15 sec to cross a platform. Find speed in km/h.
If speed is 90 km/h and distance is 270 km, how long is the journey?
Train A crosses Train B (120m) in 10 sec. Speed = 72 km/h. Find length of Train A.
A man can swim at 4 km/h in still water. Stream speed is 1 km/h. Find upstream speed.
A person takes 4 hrs to cover a distance upstream and 3 hrs downstream. Speed of boat = 6 km/h. Find stream speed.
questions.solution: Let d = distance. Upstream = d/6 - x, Downstream = d/6 + x. Solve equation.

name: blood relations
theory: Blood relation problems test your ability to decode and understand family connections. Key tips include tracking generations and gender, and translating phrases into diagrams or trees.

questions.question: A is the son of B. B is the brother of C. C is the husband of D. What is D to A?
questions.solution: C is A's uncle, D is A’s aunt.

questions.question: P is the brother of Q. Q is the sister of R. R is the son of S. What is S to P?
questions.solution: S is father or mother of P (can’t be determined).

questions.question: If A is B’s sister and C is B’s mother, then A is _____ of C?
X is the daughter of Y. Y is the son of Z. How is Z related to X?
A + B means A is the daughter of B. A - B means A is the husband of B. What does P + Q - R mean?
questions.solution: P is daughter of Q, Q is husband of R ⇒ R is P's mother-in-law.

questions.question: Pointing to a man, a woman said, 'His mother is the only daughter of my mother.' How is the woman related to the man?
If A is the father of B and C is the brother of A, how is C related to B?
X - Y means X is brother of Y; X + Y means X is sister of Y; X * Y means X is daughter of Y. What does A * B - C mean?
questions.solution: A is daughter of B, B is brother of C ⇒ A is niece of C.

questions.question: A woman introduces a man as the son of the brother of her mother. How is the man related to the woman?
If John is brother of Peter and Peter is father of Sam, what is John to Sam?
If A is mother of B and B is father of C, how is A related to C?
Pointing to a girl, Ramesh said, 'She is the daughter of the only child of my father.' Who is the girl to Ramesh?
A is brother of B. C is sister of B. How is A related to C?
A’s father’s only daughter’s brother is B. What is B to A?
Introducing a man, a woman said: 'His wife is the only daughter of my mother.' How is the man related to the woman?
P is Q's mother. R is Q's brother. S is R's father. How is S related to P?
X is daughter of Y. Y is wife of Z. How is Z related to X?
A is the son of B. C is B's father. D is C's father. What is D to A?
If A is sister of B, and B is sister of C, how is A related to C?
If P is son of Q and Q is daughter of R, how is R related to P?
